intro: Vilfa orizabae, commonly known as the Orizaba vilfa, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in cool and dry conditions. Its leaves are generally narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered. Vilfa orizabae is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its alpine environment.
